title: Prevailing showery condition expected to reduce temporarily from today
byline: The prevailing showery condition over the island is expected to be temporarily reduced from today (08) to 11 February, 2026, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Fishermen continue ‘Satyagraha’ for fourth day over seine fishing ban
byline: The Satyagraha campaign launched by a group of fishermen demanding the lifting of the ban on the use of tractor-mounted winches for Madel (seine nets) fishing activities continues for the fourth consecutive day today (08).

title: Exposition of sacred Devnimori relics continues for fourth day
byline: The exposition of the sacred Devnimori relics of Lord Buddha, brought from India, continues for the fourth consecutive day today (08) at the Gangaramaya Temple in Hunupitiya, Colombo.

title: Failed shooting attempt targeting SJB candidate in Kalutara
byline: A failed shooting attempt has been reported targeting a candidate who represented the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) in the Kalutara Municipal Council elections, police said.

title: 22-hour water cut in several areas in Kandy District today
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) have announced that a 22-hour water cut will be implemented in several areas within the Kandy District today (08).

title: India’s Modi visits Malaysia to boost trade, security ties
byline: India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi will meet his Malaysian counterpart Anwar Ibrahim on Sunday, as the two countries look to bolster trade and explore potential collaborations in semiconductors, defence and other fields.

title: Postal charges to increase from tomorrow
byline: The Department of Posts has decided to increase postal charges with effect from tomorrow (09).

title: Japan votes in test for PM Takaichi as snow weighs on turnout
byline: Japanese voters were casting ballots on Sunday in an election expected to hand Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi a resounding win, although record snowfall in parts of the country could keep many voters at home.

title: Consumers spending over Rs. 10,000 at Co-operatives to receive free life insurance
byline: The Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Cooperative Development, Wasantha Samarasinghe, announced that steps will be taken to provide free life insurance coverage to consumers who spend over Rs. 10,000 within a month at cooperative sales outlets.

title: Opposition alleges financial irregularities involving NPP councilors of Gampaha PS
byline: A group of members of the opposition of the Gampaha Pradeshiya Sabha has alleged that three councilors who were elected representing the National People’s Power (NPP) have committed financial fraud by carrying out government contracts in their own names.

title: 59% increase in medical assistance applications to President’s Fund
byline: The digitalizing and decentralizing the President’s Fund through Divisional Secretariat offices has led to a 59% increase in medical assistance applications within one year, according to the President’s Media Division.

title: Italian police fire tear gas as protesters clash near Winter Olympics hockey venue
byline: Italian police fired tear gas and a water cannon at dozens of protesters who threw firecrackers and tried to access a highway near a Winter Olympics venue on Saturday.

title: Police Constable remanded over assault on fellow officer in Hatton
byline: A Police Constable, who was arrested over the assault of another officer with a sharp object in Bogawantalawa, Hatton, has been remanded.

title: Body found in canal in Matugama
byline: A body has been discovered in a canal at the Delgas Junction along the Matugama– Agalawatta road, police said.

title: Two arrested with over 550kg of cannabis in Udawalawa
byline: Two individuals have been arrested for the possession of cannabis in the area of Udawalawa National Park.

title: Indian refiners avoid procuring Russian oil in push for US trade deal
byline: Indian refiners are avoiding Russian oil purchases for delivery in April and are expected to stay away from such trades for longer, refining and trade sources said, a move that could help New Delhi seal a trade pact with Washington.

title: King Charles to host Nigeria’s first UK state visit in 37 years
byline: King Charles III and Queen Camilla will host Nigeria’s president in the country’s first state visit to the UK in 37 years, Buckingham Palace has announced.

title: Data on impact of Cyclone Ditwah to Sri Lanka deliberated by high-level committee
byline: Preliminary Post Disaster Needs Assessment data obtained on the impact of Cyclone Ditwah, which caused widespread damage to lives, livelihoods, infrastructure and essential services across several parts of the country have been deliberated by a high-level committee, the Ministry of Defence said in a statement.

title: Brad Arnold, lead singer of Grammy-nominated rock band 3 Doors Down, dies at 47
byline: Brad Arnold, the lead singer of the Grammy-nominated rock band 3 Doors Down, died Saturday, months after he announced that he had been diagnosed with Stage 4 kidney cancer. He was 47.

title: Over 36,000 individuals subjected to inspection during special police operation
byline: A total of 526 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (07).

title: Printing of vehicle number plates to resume within next three months – DMT
byline: Plans are underway to commence printing permanent vehicle number plates within the next three months, the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) has announced.

title: Belgium-manufactured revolver recovered during special operation in Dungalpitiya
byline: A Belgium-manufactured revolver has been recovered during a special operation conducted in Dungalpitiya, Negombo.

title: Fire breaks out in a shop at Dewata Junction in Galle
byline: A fire has broken out at a scrap metal collection shop at the Dewata Junction in Galle.

title: Christchurch mosque terrorist’s Court of Appeal hearing to begin
byline: The 35-year-old Australian, who killed 51 people during the March 15, 2019, attacks, is applying for leave to appeal his conviction and sentence.

title: UN Humanitarian Priorities Plan receives US$ 22 million to support those affected by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The Sri Lanka Humanitarian Priorities Plan (HPP) launched by the United Nations Office in Colombo in December 2025 to support those affected by Cyclone Ditwah has received a total of US$ 22.4 million thus far.

title: Bribery Commission to probe complaint filed by suspended Deputy Parliament Secretary General Chaminda Kularatne
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has decided to probe a complaint filed by suspended Deputy Secretary General of Parliament Chaminda Kularatne against the Speaker of House, Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne.

title: Cabinet to review National Electricity Policy and Tariff Policy as CEB restructuring nears completion
byline: A Cabinet paper is expected to be presented tomorrow (09) on the National Electricity Policy and National Electricity Tariff Policy, marking the final phase of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) restructuring.

title: Japan’s governing party projected to win snap election majority
byline: Voting has ended in Japan’s snap election called by Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi, with exit polls pointing to a decisive win for her Liberal Democrat Party (LDP).

title: Fresh heavy rain warning issued in UK amid hundreds of flood alerts
byline: The UK Met Office has issued a fresh weather warning for heavy rain, with more than 200 flood alerts still in place.

title: Three killed in Amithirigala car–motorcycle collision
byline: A fatal road accident has been reported in Amithirigala, Thalduwa when a car collided with a motorcycle, this afternoon (8), police stated.

title: Use of jawbreaker results in the death of another wild elephant
byline: A wild elephant has died after consuming a jawbreaker also known as ‘hakka patas’ in Morawewa, Trincomalee.

title: Kite flying festival returns to Pakistan’s Lahore after 19-year ban
byline: A burst of color lit up Lahore’s night sky overnight as Pakistan’s cultural capital relaunched the Basant kite-flying festival after nearly two decades.

title: Doctor arrested after raid at abortion clinic in Beruwala
byline: A doctor has been arrested during a raid conducted at an abortion clinic operating in Beruwala, police stated.

title: Bribery Commission to probe complaint filed by Chaminda Kularatne
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has decided to probe a complaint filed by suspended Deputy Secretary General of Parliament Chaminda Kularatne against the Speaker of House, Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne.

title: Over 4,000 child abuse cases filed in high courts across Sri Lanka
byline: More than 4,000 child abuse cases have been filed in high courts across the country, the National Child Protection Authority (NCPA) has stated.

title: Ratnapura records 34.7°C as maximum temperature today
byline: The Ratnapura Weather Station recorded a maximum temperature of 34.7 °C today (08), according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: Sri Lankan man charged with harassment in Canada for creepy public filming of women
byline: Toronto police have arrested a Sri Lankan influencer, charging him with four counts of criminal harassment following a series of incidents involving the non-consensual filming of strangers.
